resources.string: get the status and control filter

Click the power button to turn filter on/off.

Move slider to the Left to make Screen Darker
or to the Right to make Screen Brighter
Tip: Darker is Better
Slide right to make filter more yellow
Sleep Aid - Automated Blue Light Filter
A Uganda Christian University (Main Campus), Computer Science Project

Designed as a final year project by Wanda Alvin Masaba, who strives for a Bachelors of Science in Computer Science degree!!

Special thanks to:
-Ms. Terhemba Michael Ahile, my supervisor
-Stackoverflow, https://stackoverflow.com
-and a few other mentions.
Project made for the year: 2019\nPresented to the panel on the 24th of April\nAt the Main Campus: TechPark Lab 2.
Overlay the status bar at the top of the screen, (might need a permissions).\nIf it doesn\'t work on the first try, please allow Sleep Aid to show system alert windows.
Sleep Aid has failed to load filter. Did you disable permissions?

Filter successfully activated.

To confirm you can still see your screen, tap "Ok" or filter will be de-activated.
To avoid errors in auto filter activation and deactivation, tap "Disable Optimisation" below and then tap "Yes".
Use volume keys to adjust filter
